revised_title: The Influence of Vegetation, Animal Life, and Season on Carbonate-of-Lime Waters
tldr: The author conducted a long-term study on the effects of vegetation, animal life, and season on the composition of carbonate-of-lime waters in an aquarium. They found that the presence of plants and the absorption of sunlight help to reduce the hardness of the water by breaking down carbonic acid produced by fish. The study also showed that during winter months, when plant activity is lower, the water becomes more acidic and harder due to increased carbonic acid production by fish.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Aquatic Ecology
